dict.acceptation: 相当大（或多）的；该注意的，应考虑的；

sent.orig: The company has made considerable savings through good housekeeping, such as avoiding wastage.
sent.trans: 该公司通过诸如避免浪费等有效的内部管理方法节约了数量可观的资金。

sent.orig: The researches indicate that some notable achievements and considerable economic benefits in this aspect were gained.
sent.trans: 大量研究表明在这方面已取得了显著成果，并收到很好的经济效益。

sent.orig: Sulfide in veinlets accounts in places for a considerable part of the total.
sent.trans: 细脉中的硫化物在有些地方，占总量的相当大的部分。

sent.orig: This approach offers a considerable promise for stabilization of pharmaceutical proteins and industrial enzymes.
sent.trans: 蛋白质环化的方法为生产稳定药物蛋白质和工业酶提供了一种新的手段。

sent.orig: The proposed cuts have caused considerable controversy.
sent.trans: 削减提议引起了很多争议。
